titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Indic 34: Nāgajī nai Nāgavantī rī bata

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Ms. Indic 34: Nāgajī nai Nāgavantī rī bata are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. notesStmt.note: 93 leaves foliated [i-ii], 1-53, [54], [i-xxxvii], upper left and lower right verso.

Mistakes covered over in yellow or blacked out; some corrections and additions in margins; significant syllables, words, or phrases highlighted in red throughout; vertical margins marked with double red line and filled in with yellow. Illustrations occur on the bottom or bottom left of the text and are bordered with red.
Bound as a codex with heavy paper wrapped in cloth.
Formerly housed as Ms. Coll. 390, Item 3023.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Manuscript is written in Marwari (old Gujarati) tells the story of the love, life, happiness, trials, and despair of Nāgajī and Nāgavantī, a royal couple living in the north-central Rajasthan (Bikaner). Contains numerous colorful illustrations of the couple, court scenes, religious ceremonies, bedroom scenes, as well as one depicting the couple playing the game of chaupar, referred to as copaḍa in the manuscript (f. 15r), the Indian precedent for the well known game Parcheesi, as well as illustrations of well known gods such as Gaṇeśa and Śiva. Some text follows the main text in a second scribal hand (f. 54v, i-iii).

msItem.title: Nāgajī nai Nāgavantī rī bata
नागजी नै नागवन्ती री बत
msItem.colophon: Colophon: iti śrīnāgajī nai nāgavaṃtī rī bāta saṃpūrna // subhabhavatuḥ kalpāṇam astu // (f. 54r).
